column11:
Listen...it's the first Sunday of the month.  We know you just got paid on Friday.  We also know how much you love Saturday nights.  You just blew your wallet - and what feels like your head - wide open.  We also know you need some love on Sundays...and that's the reason we're here for you:  Let us nurse you back to health.

It may be Deep, Progressive or Deep and Progressive...that's the way you're gonna get it on for a Sunday afternoon.

Join us once monthly, on the first Sunday you see when you flip the calendar, and let us build you back up.  Recover.

[R]evolve.  It's what we do.

column11:
Laz began on a show called Checkpoint, writing and co-hosting in 2006. His character God-fist was an egotistical sexist gamer who was willing to say anything or do anything for a laugh. The podcast ended when he became tired of playing a character that was nothing like himself, neglecting his spirituality for entertainment. Next he was called to organize a street ministry built on apologetics in 2008. He worked with the revamping of Philly Word Magazine as a writer, but left shortly after the launch. He is now focusing on creating great entertainment that is rooted in his love of Christ and this is his first project, Real Issues: Spiritual Edition AKA R.I.S.E. 

The show tackles all issues from pop culture to politics, focusing on a Christian viewpoint. Far from the normal Christian talk show, tune in and share your views with us at our website: http://wwtf-world.info/radio/rise-sundays
This Podcast was created using www.talkshoe.com

Rabbit Bite's Buns and Chou Chou are world renowned as the most powerful rabbits on television. Known for a "biting" satirical nip, these two crazy kids "review" popular culture at Salon.  For you gentle viewer, they wade through the pop culture craziness, and bring you a fun treat (with rabbits, YES!) 
 
Oh Kids, there's so much more...  
 
Chou Chou has a fun and crazy morning show  called "Coffee With Chou" which has featured key comedians, actors and bands. Oh yeah, you don't believe it...Well...tune in junior 
 
Buns will not be outdone in the talk show "game". He also has a talk show, featuring the biggest online video celebrities. It is called Talk to the Buns and it is a hard hitting question and answer session that gets to the bottom of ...well nothing really.<br>
 
Sit tight rascals, and don't miss a single episode!!

column11:
Get ready to experience the excitement of sailboat racing from home with this educational podcast series, based on raceQs' innovative 3D regatta replays.   Watch interviews with expert sailors, learn new techniques, and learn how you can Race to Win at your next regatta.

Podcasters analyze raceQs' 3D regatta replays and review racing tactics, rules, and winning strategies for all levels.  The race replays used in this podcast are created using raceQs' free smart phone app.  

Do you have something to say about your last race?  Are you an expert on the Rules?  We invite all sailors to download the raceQs app and send us a link to your favorite race replay moments.  We might interview your for our next episode!
column12: 3D sailboat race performance analysis - a powerful teaching tool

The love that develops between Luke Rowan and Rachel Ray is not universally welcomed. Mrs. Tappitt- a rich, influential, and bad woman - wishes him to marry one of her own daughters, while Rachel's mother and older sister are not sure he is worthy of her. After many adventures, everybody gets what they deserve. Characteristically to Trollope's works, there is also a secondary plot involving the election of parliament in Baslehurst."
Summary by Stav Nisser. The book lives still because of its delicate little scenes of comedy, the meeting of the lovers, Mrs. Tappitt's ball, the bedroom confidences of the Tappitts, Rachel's talks with her mother. -Walpole

Enjoy!

column11: This is not heart warming holiday fare. It is a short (one-act) unsubtle antiwar play by the English poet Alfred Noyes (1880-1958), published in 1915 while World War I is in progress. Part of the work is in verse. Music sung by Duane Steadman. (Summary by David Wales)

column11: Farið verður í dýpdina við teim evnum, ið verða vald til hvørja sending. Heldur enn at fevna víða, er tankin at fara djúpt. Tað vil siga, at kavað verður niður í eitt evni, ella ein ávísan vinkul í einum evni ella innan fyri eitt øki, heldur enn at royna at dekka alt evnið í einari og somu sending. Av tí at sendingin verður á skrá einaferð um vikuna, so ber væl til at taka somu evni uppaftur, ella onnur evni innan fyri sama øki. Navn: RadarinLongd: 115 minuttirSenditíð: Mikudag klokkan 10:05 - 12:00. Ein samandráttur verður sendur millum 17:05 og 18:00 sama dag, og síðani verður hon endursend hósdag millum 13 og 15 og fríggjanátt eisini. Radarin á Facebook (letur upp í nýggjum kaga)

Radiant Church exists to behold Jesus and put His brilliance on display.  Our Sow and Reap podcast is an extension of our mission to behold Jesus and put His brilliance on display.  We desire to encourage, challenge and stir up your faith as we broadcast our teachings each week.  Our prayer is that you would be encouraged today.

Radiant Church meets current issues with the ancient wisdom of the Christian Scriptures. We seek to honestly teach from the Bible, messages relevant to everyday life. We believe that the Bible is God's word to us and teaches us all we need to know about God, human life, and salvation.  We represent a new movement from the Lutheran tradition, driven by a passionate conviction that grace is freely given and God wants everyone to hear and trust him.
Interviews with Radiant users and discussion about the progression of the Radiant project.

The Lutheran Difference/Radical Grace Radio has a new home on the radio, 91.5FM WMIE Cocoa, Florida.  We're also heard on AM 1360 KNGN in McCook Nebraska, and we're heard on Pirate Christian Radio on the internet.

We are still a show about what it means to be a Lutheran and how the Lutheran Church makes a Christian Difference. Not just a bible study, not just a church service on tape, the Lutheran Difference is a panel discussion on topics from salvation to theology to culture from a Law and Gospel perspective.

column11: Radical Resistance Podcast

Travel: It’s become too easy these days. With the ease of online hotel bookings and travel review sites, your holiday is never more than a couple clicks away. But if you’re looking for more than a “Yelp” experience, this is your show. Your host, Justin Jones, is a self-styled travel guru who likes his travel with more grit than glamour. He’ll drag you off the beaten path to unlock the secrets of exotic locales while cutting to the core of local culture. Hear what the locals eat, where they hang out, and where to find the best deals and bargains. Discover what life is like on the other side of a one way ticket with Justin Jones!

These shows were originally produced in 1987. New episodes are published weekly from Opening Day till the completion of the World Series.

column11: Herzlich willkommen bei Radio Blind Power, dem Schweizer Integrationsradio. Durch den Tag liefern wir dir non-Stop aktuellste und angesagteste Musik. Am Abend packen dich unsere Sendungen zu DVD's, Kinoprogramm, Informationen aus dem Sehbehindertenwesen sowie intime Gespräche mit spannenden Personen. Deine Rückmeldung zählt. Als Hörer wollen wir wissen, was dir gefällt und was nicht und als Mitarbeiter ist dein Angebot zur Arbeitskraft willkommen. Bei Radio Blind Power arbeiten Menschen mit und ohne Behinderungen mit. Da gehörst du dazu!

1 – 31 March 2012

Online 24 hours each day, avfestival.co.uk / thepixelpalace.org

Radio Boredcast is a 744-hour continuous online radio project, curated by artist Vicki Bennett (People Like Us) with AV Festival 12.  In response to our ambiguous relationship with time - do we have too much or not enough? - Radio Boredcast celebrates the detail, complexity and depth of experience lost through our obsession with speed.

The full list of participants in Radio Boredcast with new and exclusive recordings and shows are Carl Stone, Pseu Braun & Alex Orlov, Touch, Rob Weisberg, Nicolas Collins, Andrew Lahman, Chris & Cosey, Jonathan Dean and Transmuteo, Cheese Snob Wendy, Kevin Nutt, Tony Coulter, Daniel Menche, Scott Williams, John Wynne, Chris Watson, Jem Finer and Longplayer, Tim Maloney, Ergo Phizmiz, Matmos, Dave Soldier, Charlie and Busy Doing Nothing, Andrew Sharpley, Nancy O Graham, Gwilly Edmondez, Anna Ramos & Roc Jiménez De Cisneros, Doug Horne, Irene Moon, David Suisman, Radio Web MACBA, Mark Gergis and Porest, Jez Riley French, Don Joyce, Carlo Patrao and Zepelim, Dorian Jones, Jason Willett, Zach Layton, Primate Arena with Alex Drool and Eran Sachs, David Toop, Dylan Nyoukis, Jared Blum and GiganteSound, Ed Pinsent, Adrian Philips aka Mr Rotorvator, Axel Stockburger, Craig Dworkin, Felix Kubin, People Like Us, Language Removal Services, Daniela Cascella, John Levack Drever, Joel Eaton, Clay Pigeon, Gudrun Gut, Charles Powne, Carl Abrahamsson,  Andreas Bick and Silent Listening, Phantom Circuit, Patti Schmidt aka Wheelie Houdini, Leif Elggren, Ken Freedman, Erik Bünger, Douglas Benford, Christof Migone, BJNilsen, Andy Baio, Adam Thomas aka Preslav Literary School, Caroline Bergvall, Ken Garson aka Kenzo, Tapeworm, Brent Clough and The Night Air, Ilan Volkov, Nat Roe, Steven Ball, X41, The Long Now Foundation, Sharon Gal, Michael Ruby, Jonathan Leidecker, DJ/rupture, Gordon Monahan, Michael Cumella aka MAC, Lloyd Dunn and nula, DDDJJJ666, and Kenneth Goldsmith.

column2: Radio Bremen: Best of Bremen Vier
column11: Ein Channel, der immer wieder für Überraschungen gut ist: Hier landet das besonders kuriose, überaus spannende und zum Teil grenzwertige Material aus dem Bremen-Vier-Kosmos. Für Freunde des skurrilen Humors unverzichtbar.

column2: Radio Bremen: buten un binnen um 6
column11: Montags bis freitags beginnt Radio Bremen TV um 18 Uhr mit einer sechsminütigen Kompaktausgabe von buten un binnen. Geboten wird eine erste Zusammenfassung des Tagesgeschehens in Bremen und umzu, sowie ein Überblick über die Themen der Hauptsendung um 19:30 Uhr.

Sobald Prominente nach Bremen kommen, schnappt Winfried Hammelmann sie sich und macht mit ihnen Interviews, wie man sie sonst nicht hört. Das Besondere: Er gibt eigentlich nur Stichwörter, man bekommt aber sehr persönliche Antworten und das liegt woran? Genau: An der Auswahl der Stichwörter!
Der Comedy Club Bremen stellt euch regelmäßig angesagte Comedians auf die Bühne. Das Beste aus ihren Shows könnt ihr hier direkt auf euren MP3-Player ziehen!

Hier hÃ¶rt ihr die vielleicht schrÃ¤gsten, schrillsten und durchgeknalltesten Krimis. Denn wenn Detective Brian Brain ermittelt, fliegen die Balken und biegen sich die Fetzen. Ein Rundfunk-Redakteur sagte einmal: "'Detective Brian Brain', das ist wie 'Nackte Kanone' ... nur kÃ¼rzer ... und ohne Leslie Nielsen ... ohne Priscilla Presley ... ach und ohne Bilder."

Zum Thema: Jede Woche fragt das Nordwestradio Friedrich Nowottny nach seiner Einschätzung zur politischen Lage in der Bundesrepublik.
Hinweis: Der Channel wird zum Jahresende 2013 eingestellt.
Wie und warum berichten Medien über ein Ereignis? Welche Wirkung haben Bilder? Darum geht es in unserer neuen Kolumne mit dem Medienwissenschaftler Jochen Hörisch immer montags um 8:15 Uhr.

Die schlechtesten Aufnahmen aller Zeiten, die schÃ¶nsten LiebeserklÃ¤rungen, die wildesten Trends, die schrÃ¤gsten VÃ¶gel: Joachim Deicke nimmt sie sich in seiner wÃ¶chentlichen Musikkolumne vor. Globale Stile, gerissenes Marketing, spektakulÃ¤re Events, skurrile Instrumente: Alles ist Thema.
Prominente Gäste live im Nordwestradio.

Von Medienscheu keine Spur: Der Lutscher stellt sich den aufdringlichen Fragen der Presse, spricht Ã¼ber das wichtige Spiel heutemorgenabend und plaudert aus dem Leben als Profi(?)-Kicker - regelmÃ¤Ã?ig bei Bremen Vier.
Themen rund ums Meer aus den Bereichen Wissenschaft, Literatur, Politik, Kunst und Musik.

Sobald die Morgenshow gelaufen ist, nehmen sich Roland & Ike oder Juk & Daniela - je nachdem, wer gerade Schicht schiebt - nochmal Zeit, um die Sendung Revue passieren zu lassen. Sie plaudern Geheimnisse aus dem Redaktionsalltag aus, ziehen Kollegen durch den Kakao - also der perfekte Zeitvertreib für alle Bremen-Vier-Insider und die, die es noch werden wollen.

Der Journalist und TV-Produzent Friedrich Küppersbusch kommentiert an jedem Mittwoch um 8:10 Uhr im Nordwestradio das Wort der Woche. Die Redaktion wählt einen Begriff aus, der die politische oder kulturelle Diskussion geprägt oder für Aufregung gesorgt hat. Dann wird im klingenden Wörterbuch nachgeschlagen.
Aktuelle plattdeutsche Nachrichten, montags bis freitags um 10:30 Uhr auf Bremen Eins.
Einmal pro Woche versorgt euch Filmexperte Martin Neuhaus mit Infos rund um Kinofilme, neue und besondere DVDs und alles, was mit dem schwarzen Kasten sonst noch so zu tun hat.

Die NSA weiß, was wir letzten Sommer getan haben und Youtube-Katzen lenken schon wieder von der Arbeit ab: Was auch immer im Netz wichtig wird, erklärt die wochenwebschau von Radio Bremen. Die Sendung läuft immer freitags in den digitalen ARD-Kanälen tagesschau24 (19:45 Uhr), EinsPlus (20:00 Uhr) und Einsfestival (23:30 Uhr), im Internet natürlich jederzeit auf wochenwebschau.de.

Some of the daily features will include<br><b>On This Date:  A look at entertainment and pop culture history featuring the #1 Song On This Date.  <br><br> Celebrities Who Need Our Prayers:  Humorous commentary on the continuing pursuit of Fame and Bad Behavior in the La La Crowd.<br><br> Radio Bungalow is very interactive with our fans and social media friends, along with local and international guests, businesses, events and festivals. Dana and Gracie are excited to share the subtle jewels that are waiting to be uncovered in the world of entertainment, diversions and the fun of the Tennessee Valley and South Eastern United States. <br><br>  The Genesis is the fun, humor and music of the region. column11:
Rádio Chama é um programa semanal realizado pelo Coletivo Chama para a Rádio Roquette Pinto (94,1FM) no Rio de Janeiro. 

Rompendo fronteiras entre períodos históricos, continentes, estilos e gêneros, cada programa, apresentado pelos compositores Pedro Moraes e Thiago Thiago de Melo, com participações frequentes dos demais membros do coletivo (Ivo Senra, Sergio Krakowski, Thiago Amud, Cezar Altai e Renato Frazão), é uma viagem por temas humanos universais e perenes -- por exemplo, a Mulher, a Loucura, os Ciclos, a Luxúria -- revelados através da mais poderosa linguagem do homem: a música. 

Em seu repertório, o programa visita do progressivo setentista a peças de câmera barrocas, da produção contemporânea de musica brasileira aos princípios do jazz, e descobre conexões inesperadas entre Vivaldi e Rock'n Roll, Clementina de Jesus e Bjork, Messiaen e Nelson Cavaquinho.
column12: Rádio Chama Rio de Janeiro Brasil Musica de Exploração Atemporal

column11: Italienisches Ambiente in der deutschen Radiolandschaft. "Radio Colonia" sendet jeden Abend von Montag bis Freitag für Italienerinnen und Italiener in Deutschland und für Italienfans. Aktuelles aus Politik, Kultur und Gesellschaft. Wir widmen uns insbesondere der italienischen Community in Deutschland. "Radio Colonia", la finestra italiana nel panorama radiofonico tedesco, va in onda tutti i giorni dal lunedì al venerdì per gli italiani in Germania e per tutti gli amanti del Belpaese. Al centro del programma anche l'attualità dal mondo politico, culturale e sociale tedesco, il tutto con un occhio di riguardo per la comunità italiana in Germania, per le sue storie e i suoi problemi.

column11: "Radio Cosmopolis: Music Without Borders" is a weekly program hosted by Shane Graham. It explores the musical traditions of a world in constant migration and transformation--where those traditions come from, and what happens when they intersect with others and become something new. Some episodes explore a particular region, theme, or musical style, while others roam the planet. On a given program, you might hear: afrobeat, gypsy punk, reggae, bhangra, Senegalese rap, Thai funk, Cuban jazz, Celtic electronica, tango, Bollywood, dubstep, trance, and much, much more. Tune in every Friday night at 9:00 p.m. and join the adventures among the hybrid musical offspring of globalization.
column12: Music Without Borders

RadioDave, or Dave Pollard, began his journey into the world of music at the age of two when he first sat behind a drumkit; a path which he’s been walking for over two decades. This walk has led him to branch out in a number of different musical outlets, eventually landing him a career in radio production. The name Radio Dave, given to him on a whim by a co-host, quickly began to stand for something in the music community of Fort McMurray, Alberta. Until eventually, he stepped back from radio and decided to keep his production skills sharpened by sliding them into an attempt behind the DJ booth. Decades of being a skilled percussionist and human metronome, and a vast knowledge of music and composition helped him transition into this scene. From t-shirts, to stickers, to car wraps, to tattoos, to having shots and drinks named after him, the RadioDave brand represents two things that are rarely seen working together; talent, and the ability to market and sell that talent.

To book Radio Dave: rd0davemanagement@gmail.com

column11: Join host Gregory Berg for Radio Enso- Tools and Inspiration for Conscious Living, every Monday at 6 p.m. Pacific/9 Eastern on the BlogTalkRadio network. Radio Enso is a weekly, in-depth conversation with personal development leaders, thought leaders, and inspirational people from around the world. I aim to discover what makes other creatives, seekers, and non-conformists tick. We discuss a wide variety of topics including alternative career and lifestyle options, spirituality, travel, philosophy, and optimal living. Since July 2011, my guests have included Dr. Brene Brown, Chris Brogan, Nancy Duarte, Danielle LaPorte, Jonathan Fields, Susan Piver, Chris Guillebeau, Pamela Slim, Tess Vigeland, Jeff Goins, Michael Bungay Stanier, Tara Gentile, Adam Baker, Brian Johnson, Jennifer Louden, Betsy Chasse, Don Miguel Ruiz Jr., Eric Klein, Natalie Sisson, Jonathan Mead, Ishita Gupta, J.D. Roth, Jodi Ettenberg, Charlie Gilkey, Farnoosh Brock, Dave Ursillo, Bridget Pilloud, Jia Jiang, Catherine Just, and MANY others. Each week, my guests share their life story, discuss the challenges they've faced, and offer various "takeaways" that listeners can use on their own journey towards a more conscious and purpose-filled life. Listen to Radio Enso live here or download or stream archived shows at BlogTalkRadio, via the iTunes Podcast Store, the Stitcher Radio app, or at http://www.radioenso.com.

column11:
Capitaneado por Manolo Gutiérrez , Radio Expande es un programa dirigido a cualquier persona interesada en su crecimiento interior y en expandir su conocimiento en la verdadera realidad… En el programa se hablará de todo un poco. Misterio, fé, espiritualidad… etc.

En él se hablará de todo un poco. Se hablará de economía y posibles soluciones, de sucesos nuevos que ocurran, de qué está pasando en este mundo, si es verdad o mentira lo que nos cuentan los gobiernos y qué ocultan, si es verdad o mentira lo que nos cuentan las profecías, etc. Estaremos pendientes de este año 2012 histórico por las profecías maya y años posteriores e iremos viendo si estaban en lo cierto o no. Hablaremos de astrología con mi gran amigo Daniel porras y Manolo Muñoz. Pero sobre todo se hablará de lo que yo llamo "cosas raras".

Intentaremos llegar a conclusiones o al menos comentar y comunicar los temas para hacer pensar sobre ello y darnos cuenta de que no solo existe lo que vemos, lo que nos cuentan en la televisión  o leemos en periódicos, sino que existe mucho más y poco a poco se va descubriendo gracias a la física cuántica. El proyecto se llama expande como he anunciado antes. Expande tu mente expande tu conocimiento, expande tu visión de la realidad. Como leí en un libro la mente es como un paracaídas si no se abre no sirve para nada.

Saludos

column11: IR travels the globe working with pockets of Indigenous Resistance in the Fourth World to get their messages out from behind the propaganda machines that deny them the freedom of the press. Collaborating of musicians and djs and remixers, such as Asian Dub Foundation, Ramjac, Dr Das, Underground  Resistance, and Ramjac, words, chants, calls for freedom are set to Reggae, Dub, Detroit Techno, and the world fusion beats from ADF and Dr Das and released to the world as IR media.  This podcast will collect the latest tracks from the IR travels and collaborations, along with key crucial mixes from their fiery past. Dr Loretta Collins Klobah wrote in the Jamaica Journal; "The IR dub attitude can be, by turns, either a burn-down-Babylon "fiery dub or a self-reflexive, meditative dub." Through free releases and downloads, IR has set up a campaign to send these tracks back into the indigenous communities, utilizing any means necessary to get the music and messages heard passed the restrictive regimes that keep the indigenous down and disenfranchised. Free track downloads and more at www.believedigital.com Executive Producer: The Ghost. Minister of Reality Administration: Tapedave. Dubpodology by Prasonik and Dubdem Soundsystem.

“RFM will be free of political censorship by the ruling BN coalition and plans to provide a platform for alternative ideas and viewpoints”, explains founder Clare Rewcastle Brown, who is basing the programme out of the UK.

“It is well known that all press and broadcast media currently operating in Malaysia are forced to unquestioningly support and promote the ruling BN coalition and to denigrate the opposition parties, while excluding them from the chance to put their own policies and agendas before the people”.

column11: In 1966 Peter Bergman's pioneering talk show “Radio Free oZ” airs on Pacifica Network's KPFK. Bergman invited three friends – Philip Austin, the show's producer; David Ossman, the station's former dramatic director; and Philip Proctor, an actor – to join him as the four of them pretended to be the panel of an imaginary “oZ Film Festival”. This performance of "Radio Free oZ" marked the beginning of The Firesign Theatre's unparalleled career in comedy. Bergman returned with RFoZ in 2010, back on the 'air' with podcasts Monday through Friday, co-hosted with David Ossman. Sadly, Peter entered the Bozo Bus one last time on March 9, 2012, after complications from Leukemia. The Radio Free Oz team will continue Peter's legacy with archival material.

column11:
Radio FRIHED går bag om aktuelle emner - gerne dybdeborende. 
Studievært: Hans Juel. 
Dybdeborende interviews og samtaler, der giver tid til at nå hele vejen rundt om et emne på deltageres betingelser. Bolden er det vigtigste - ikke sparket. 
Redaktionen søger emner inden for politik - helst lokalpolitik. Religion - helst tolerenceskabende. Samfundsdebat - helst det andre medier overser. Kunst - ikke om men med kunstnere. 
Tidligere gæster bl.a.: Henrik Rindom, læge, Jan Tommy Hansen, Cleanhouse, Finn Rudaizky, BR (S), Preben Møller Hansen, BR (P), Ole Henzen, BR ( K), Helle Shelle, BR+MF (K), Ben Haddou, BR (CD), Louise Frevert, MF (DF), Martin Geertsen, BR (V), Heidi Wang, BR (V), Morten Kabell, BR (Ø), Lise Helveg, BR (V), Ib Makwarth, filminstruktør, Niels Dalsgarrd, Science Fiction Cirklen, Henrik Højstrøm (VU), Susanne Beck, Karavanefonden, Thorbjørn Meyer, Kenan Seeberg, journalist (EB), Marie Outze, Norden mod Narkotika, Sai Baba, Jørgen Jørgensen, Narconon, Fritz Pedersen, musiklærer på Blindeinstituttet + rigtig mange andre! Podcasten er på dansk.

column11:
This Podcast is one of the latest products from Gonzo Multimedia, and is the best way to get direct access to all the shows produced by Radio Gonzo. Gonzo Multimedia brings you a wide variety of products from a number of renowned artists and record labels, largely spanning rock and pop music from the '60s to today, and the Gonzo catalogue includes 100% exclusive products that are unavailable elsewhere.
 
 In addition to a varied and wildly eclectic catalogue, Gonzo also boasts its own YouTube TV channel and its own dedicated streaming web radio service, which features exclusive interviews with some of the world's biggest artists, all of which are brought to you here in the Radio Gonzo Podcast.
 
Gonzo Multimedia also have a large back catalogue of DVD releases including DVDs from Ginger Baker, Yes, Renaissance, T'Pau, Nik Kershaw and Van Der Graaf Generator, and albums from Gordon Giltrap and Rick Wakeman, Hawkwind, Soft Machine, The Fall and Gong  with  many more to come. Gonzo also exclusively distributes releases from the great British film director Tony Palmer, and some of the recent best selling DVD releases from Tony Palmer featuring Frank Zappa, Jack Bruce and Leonard Cohen have been released through Gonzo Multimedia.
 
With further exclusives in the pipeline, now is the time to subscribe to the Radio Gonzo Podcast and receive all the latest updates as they are released.
 
Also sign up to our mailing list for news on releases, web casts and TV shows, not to mention advance news of upcoming tours from Gonzo related artists and you will not miss out on any forthcoming exclusives and special offers!

column2: Radio Hamburg: Das Bundesligatagebuch von HSV-Boss Bernd Hoffmann
column11: "Hallo liebes Tagebuch, hier ist wieder Dein Bernd." Mit diesen Worten begrüßt Sie ab sofort immer freitags um 7:17 Uhr HSV-Boss Bernd Hoffmann. In seinem Bundesligatagebuch wirft er einen Blick auf das kommende Fußballwochenende und Sie erfahren, wie es um die Rothosen gestellt ist. Heißt das Volksparkstadion vielleicht bald „Always-Ultra-Arena“, wie lange darf Armin Veh noch auf der Trainerbank sitzen oder ist das nächste Spiel vielleicht sein Entscheidungsspiel? Montags gibt’s um 17:20 Uhr dann das Resümee von Bernd Hoffmann zum letzten Spiel.
column12: Radio Hamburg: Das Bundesligatagebuch von HSV-Boss Bernd Hoffmann

column2: Radio Hamburg: Das Bundesligatagebuch von HSV-Sportdirektor und Teamchef Frank Arnesen
column11: "Hallo liebes Tagesbuch" - Mit diesen Worten begrüßt Sie vor den Spielen des HSV der Sportchef und Coach Frank Arnesen. In seinem Bundesligatagebuch wirft er einen Blick auf das kommende Fußballwochenende und Sie erfahren, wie es um die Rothosen gestellt ist. Wie viel Zeit braucht die Mannschaft noch, bis es wieder läuft? Welches Sprichwort hat Franks Oma in Kopenhagen für ihren Enkel. Die Antworten gibt's im HSV-Bundesligatagebuch von HSV-Sportdirektor und Teamchef Frank Arnesen.
column12: Radio Hamburg: Das Bundesligatagebuch von HSV-Sportdirektor und Teamchef Frank Arnesen

column11: Ob Handy, PC, Spielkonsolen oder Games. In der E-World stellen wir Ihnen montags um 15:30 Uhr bei Radio Hamburg die neuesten Geräte auf dem Markt vor, verraten Ihnen welches Spiel neue Rekorde bricht oder was die neuen Spielkonsolen alles können. Bleiben auch Sie up to date!

column2: Radio Hamburg: Kevin allein zu Haus
column11: Die WM findet ohne Kevin Kuranyi statt. Dafür hat er eine tägliche Standleitung ins deutsche Lager. Hören sie jeden Tag bei Radio Hamburg auf 103.6 "Kevin allein zu Haus“ mit seinen Kumpels in Südafrika telefonieren. Neueste Infos aus dem Camp der Deutschen nicht nur direkt in Kevins, sondern auch direkt in ihr Wohnzimmer. Anhören und ablachen!

column11: Das iPhone läuft nicht, der Rechner zeigt nur einen blauen Bildschirm oder das Auto macht komische Geräusche? PC Oma Frieda 2.0 kümmert sich um technische Probleme und alles drum herum. Sie wissen keine Antwort? Dann nicht verzagen und sondern Oma Frieda fragen!

Podcasts from RadioLeMans.com, including coverage of races from the FIA World Endurance Championship (WEC), European Le Mans Series (ELMS) and of course the Le Mans 24 hours. In addition there's the weekly motorsport magazine show Midweek Motorsport, in depth interviews with motor racing's biggest names, and behind the scenes looks at teams and manufacturers.

For over a decade, prior to his retirement, Dr. Monteith led a delegation of physicians from Santa Cruz County to the House of Delegates of the California Medical Association. For 10 years he led the battle within organized medicine in California to address the AIDS epidemic as a medical issue rather than a civil rights issue. As a result of his experiences trying to implement an effective medical approach to the HIV epidemic, he wrote the book, "AIDS:The Unnecessary Epidemic", the widely circulated pamphlet, "To Deceive a Nation", and more recently, "A Nation Deceived and Betrayed." Supported by physicians across our nation, his public health approach to the HIV epidemic was eventually accepted by the California Medical Association. Unfortunately, powerful forces continue to oppose the dictates of doctors. Dr Monteith currently spends five hours daily on talk radio in California. He writes extensively, and lectures on geopolitics. He has spent 30 years researching the causes for America's spiritual and moral decline.
Pipes Output

column11: Radio Libre, un blog musical pas que musical? On trouvera dans Radio Libre, des sujets typiquement musicaux. Par exemple chaque semaine une session live acoustique (son et bien sur vidéo), un machin sur les slows, sur la musique pour les filles, sur les pochettes de disques, sur les bandes originales de film. Des classements de tous poils. Du texte, du son, de la vidéo, de la photo. On ira surtout voir les artistes, les faire parler, jouer? Radio Libre, ce sont seize personnes qui bloguent aux quatre coins du monde. Avec une passion commune, la musique.

column11: radio madrid is broadcast live from my basement (in madrid obviously). i hate trying to categorize music but i suppose you need some idea before deciding to just click and listen... i play soundtracks, afro funk, brazilian, instrumental hip hop, broken beats and i try to make sense of it all. a lot of this music you won't find on cd (let alone itunes) - i'm just trying to get it heard by a larger audience. search for radio madrid in itunes and subscribe!

column11: Ludwig von Mises-Institutet i Sverige strävar efter att sprida frihetens budskap till en svensktalande publik. Vi gör det dels genom att sprida kunskap om frihetens moral, vilken säger att det är fel att utöva oprovocerat våld, att hota och stjäla från andra människor, även om man kallar sig staten. Dels genom att sprida kunskap om österrikisk ekonomisk teori, en vetenskap som förklarar hur människor agerar, hur välstånd skapas och varför staten enbart kan förstöra välstånd. Staten är den allvarligaste fienden till fred, frihet och välstånd, varför vårt motto är ”Mot staten, för fred och frihet, egendom och rätten till ditt eget liv”. Vi arbetar genom att publicera eget och översatt material på www.mises.se, ordna evenemang och sända denna podradio.
column12: Mot staten, för fred och frihet

column11:
Mulisha.tv is the home of the comedy talk radio podcast thing called "Radio Mulisha".  The show is hosted by Shawn Rob and Hollywood Adam with co-hosts Shoplifta Don and French'E, as well as guests visiting the studio from time to time.  Radio Mulisha has no set topic, but strives for a hilarious view on everything! The show is broadcasted live every Wednesday night starting at 7:30 Eastern.  We interact with our listeners during these shows with tons of methods of contact, be it phone call in, chat and text message.  The show is also available afterwards to listen to via podcast, download, or through the website.
"Radio Mulisha" also provides a special "behind the scenes" look at the show via the "Open Source" shows.  These shows are only available via mulisha.tv!

column11: Animateur Radio, TV, Dj, journaliste pour la presse spécialisée, Dario est aujourd'hui l'une des figures incontestées de la culture rnb.Plus de 600 interviewes à son actif, avec des artistes emblématiques de la scène rnb, de Justin Timberlake à Usher en passant par les Black Eyes Peas ou encore Mariah Carey, Kanye West, Beyoncé, Matt, Akon, Kayna Samet, Pussy cat Dolls... Corneille, Craig David ont fait leurs premiers pas derrière le micro de Dario alors qu'ils étaient encore inconnus. Dans Radio New-York Dario balance des nouveaux sons, reçoit les stars du RNB. RADIO NEW YORK, c'est un concept décliné à 360 ° : la radio, la télé, un site internet, des produits dérivés et des soirées en club.

column11: Radio Obscura is an Arts and Culture focused show that will attempt to take the listener through their stereo and transplant them into the world of the stories and topics covered each week. While the technology behind sucking someone up through a stereo and physically moving them to another space/time is shaky. We are working on it everyday. Began by members of the Middletown, CT based Sandbox Arts Collective, Radio Obscura’s episode's will be loosely topical, and should be applied liberally at least once a week. Its like looking, but for your ears.

column11: Exploring Okinawan culture wtih Tuigwaa-chan (Helen Fukuhara Yamada) through sanshin, odori (dance), and a variety of other aspects such as arts and crafts, language, history, folk tales, foods, and more. Focus will include Okinawan events locally (DC area), other parts of the USA, and hopefully beyond (world-wide). Although this show highlights Okinawan culture, she hopes everyone in some way can benefit from the general perspective of how one searches and identifies with their heritage, honors customs, respects parents, and sets an example (hopefully good) through leadership to their family, friends, and ultimately community. Join Tuigwaa-chan on her journey to learn more about herself, make friends, and her attempt to one day meet and connect with her Okinawan family (Uncle Chogi) and spread the joy, peace, and love of Okinawa through treasures like sanshin and odori (dance). She will also play sanshin so submit requests in advance. Call or contact Tuigwaa-chan with news, events, or share other Okinawan experiences.

column11:
Opinionsverket är frukten av att många engagerade har hört av sig till LO och vill delta i det opinionsbildande arbetet. Opinionsverket är ett helt nytt sätt att samarbeta. Alla vi som deltar i nätverket skapar opinionsbildning, och vi gör det tillsammans. Vi kommer från olika håll och har olika ambitionsnivå, vissa har sin blogg som sin arena medan andra twittrar eller är aktiva på instagram och facebook. Ytterligare andra kanske inte arbetar via internet överhuvudtaget.

Gemensamt för oss i Opinionsverket är att vi har ett  progressivt löntagarperspektiv och delar LO:s-grundläggande värderingar. Vi vet också att när vi organiserar oss och samarbetar blir vi starkare.

Opinionsverket gör till exempel research, faktakoll, tar fram underlag för nyheter, och debattartiklar. Opinionsverket hjälper sina medlemmar att kunna föra debatt och diskutera, både på arbetsplatser och på olika arenor på nätet. På sikt kommer vi erbjuda möjlighet till träffar och möten.

column11:
98.2 Radio Paradiso – Musik zum Verwöhnen 

Radio Paradiso aus Berlin. Musik zum Verwöhnen. Entspannen.
Informieren. Inspirieren. Mit uns kommen Sie gelassen durch den Tag, denn unsere Musik verbreitet keine Hektik: Gefühlvoller Rock & Pop von den 70ern bis heute. Wir informieren nicht nur über das tagesaktuelle Weltgeschehen -  unsere Spezialthemen sind:  Gesundheit, Kultur, Berlin, soziales Engagement und Familie. Als einziges christliches Privatradio Deutschlands, das täglich 24 Stunden sendet, sind uns die christlichen Werte, wie Nächstenliebe, Toleranz und Bewahrung der Schöpfung,  die unsere Gesellschaft zusammenhalten, besonders wichtig.

Der Livetalk für Retrogamer ab 8-Bit aufwärts! Der Scene-Talk ist eine unregelmäßige Sendereihe in Form einer Interview- und Diskussionsrunde via Skype und seit Ende 2009 fester Bestandteil unseres Liveprogramms. Prominente aus der Computer- und Videospielebranche der 80er und 90er Jahre treffen auf interessierte Hörer und Moderatoren. Ob Retrokonsole oder Browserspiel, zwischen 8 und 64-Bit ist für Jeden etwas dabei. Und vielleicht seid ihr sogar die Nächsten in unserer Runde. Werft einfach mal einen Blick auf unseren Sendeplan oder in den Sendebereich unseres Forums, schlagt neue Themen und prominente Gäste vor oder beteiligt euch als Gesprächspartner an der nächsten Konferenz live während der Sendung.

column11: Boy meets girl. Boy woos girl. Boy keeps the passion alive through cross-country Podcasts? Welcome to the \"virtual\" relationship hijinxs of Josh and Trix where anything goes. There\'s an old saying that if you want trouble, get yourself a redhead. Josh and Trix have done just that; two flame-haired creatures lucky enough to have found double trouble in each other and a partner in crime to chat it up with in the heat of the night. Get in on the conversation. Become privy to the witty, mind-bending, encyclopedic banter. Wild, unpredictable, opinionated, intense, sexy and untamed. Everything you\'d expect from a redhead and more. Tune in today and welcome to Radio Redhead.

column11: Radio RMX is a mixed-format (music and talk) show that focuses on contemporary artistic, political and social issues surrounding remix culture. The program features discussion on current topics relevant to creative appropriation, free culture, open internet & copyright reform; interviews with DJs, artists, lawyers, scholars, & activists; and presentation of music, sound art, and other forms of remixed media. Your hosts are the directors of Brooklyn's annual RE/Mixed Media Festival: Tom Tenney, Stephanie Corleto, and Robert Prichard. New shows every last Sunday of the month on bboxradio.com.

column11: Featuring two hours of classic radio shows every week

Radio's Golden Days salutes Radio from a by gone era. Sit back and enjoy the sounds of a simpler time on this edition of Radio's Golden Days. 
Copyright Notice: I do not own the copyrights to any of the shows available on this site. I believe that many copyrights have expired, and that many of the shows are in the public domain because they were never copyrighted. I do not sell the recordings or charge for access to my site. The purpose of this site is to bring the exciting world of Old Time Radio to a whole new generation of listeners using the new technology of the Internet. I am not and would not try to deprive the original creators of any money due to them, and we will remove any recording from our site that is shown to violate a copyright. For more information about copyrights for Old Time Radio shows, go to http://creativecommons.org/licenses/publicdomain/
This Podcast was created using www.talkshoe.com

column11:
Подкаст человека, который мечтает о радио и иногда в него играет.
Вышел в подкаст-эфир в 2005 году, на заре подкастинга, благодаря проекту Василия Стрельникова и является первым подкастом из Украины. Как многие говорят - подкаст ни о чем. Но, вместе с тем, кому-то нравиться и каждый находит в нем что-то свое. Говорим "за жизнь". Говорим о том, что интересно или просто выдаем потоки сознания. Иногда приходят гости живьем либо по Skype. Вобщем - играем в радио.
column12: Подкаст человека, который мечтает о радио и иногда в него играет.

column2: Radio Sonora - Community Web Radio della Bassa Romagna
column11:
Radio Sonora ? la Community Web Radio di tutti i  cittadini della Bassa Romagna.

Radio Sonora ? la voce dei giovani e si propone come uno spazio laboratorio per la sperimentazione di nuovi linguaggi e media.

Oltre ad ascoltare e  visionare audio, video e trasmissioni,  tutti possono partecipare attivamente e da protagonisti alla vita della radio inserendo i propri contributi e progettando un programma.

Partecipa ai contenuti con le tue idee, Radio Sonora ? aperta a tutti: dagli studenti delle Scuole Superiori, ai ragazzi dei centri giovani ai musicisti delle Sale Prove, ai gruppi informali.

Radio Sonora sar? il centro di un percorso di partecipazione all'avanguardia per creare diritti ed opportunit? per tutti.

La redazione centrale ha sede a Bagnacavallo e in ognuno dei Comuni dell'Unione della Bassa Romagna (Alfonsine, Bagnara di Romagna, Cinselice, Cotignola, Fusignano, Lugo, Massa Lombarda) ? stata creata una redazione locale. 8 redazioni nelle quali sono attivi e partecipano numerosi giovani del territorio.

Referenti

 - Tavolo degli Assessori delle Politiche Giovanili dell'Unione dei Comuni della Bassa Romagna
 - Mirco Bagnari, sindaco referente dell'Unione dei Comuni della Bassa Romagna alle Politiche Culturali, Progetto Giovani e Sport
 - Giuseppe Masetti, referente coordinamento Politiche Culturali e Giovanili dell'Unione dei Comuni della Bassa Romagna
 - Gianni Gozzoli, direttore artistico
 - Yuri Briccolani, coordinamento
column12: Radio Sonora ? la Community Web Radio di tutti i  cittadini della Bassa Romagna

column11: Baladodiffusion (podcast) des émissions hebdomadaires de Radio-Talbot, Copyright 2014 Tous droits réservés Denis Talbot. « Notre vocation est simple : informer du mieux de nos connaissances nos membres en plus de leur offrir un lieu de rencontre ou ils peuvent échanger et discuter dans le respect. Les ordinateurs et les jeux vidéo c'est ma vie! ». Denis Talbot partage sa passion pour les jeux vidéo à tous les soirs, en direct sur les ondes de MusiquePlus. Depuis 2005, Radio-Talbot occupe une place de choix sur Internet. Les Internautes se donnent rendez-vous hebdomadairement afin d'écouter et participer aux émissions radiophoniques de Denis Talbot et de son équipe. Le site, en constante évolution, ne cesse de grandir et de gagner en popularité. Il est là pour rester.
column12: Baladodiffusion des émissions hebdomadaires de Radio-Talbot, avec Denis Talbot et Ian Richards, ils partagent leur passion pour les jeux vidéo, la technologie et les gadgets, le tout sur une touche d'humour.

column11:
RadioViGiova è un’occasione di incontro e di ascolto: lungo le molteplici strade del progetto RadioViGiova, si incontrano giovani in ricerca, da chi compone lo staff a chi ci ascolta in FM o in internet, agli ospiti in studio: ognuno si porta dentro la propria esperienza, ognuno condivide con gioia i passi del proprio cammino; è un intrecciarsi di percorsi con un centro di gravità permanente in comune: quella dimensione spirituale che ognuno chiama con nomi diversi, quella voce interiore che per alcuni lo scontro con le scelte quotidiane, per altri ancora una linea sottile difficile da seguire…

L’ascolto e il rispetto della ricchezza dentro ogni diversità vogliono essere gli ingredienti speciali della ricetta RadioViGiova; così di puntata in puntata si è realizzata una rete fitta e splendida di mille colori, che unisce moltissimi giovani: lungo questi intrecci corrono idee, pensieri, sentimenti, speranze, progetti, in un generarsi esponenziale per contagio…

Linguaggio comune è la musica, scelta, amata, ballata; quella che ti accompagna come un tarlo nella mente lungo la giornata; quella che si unisce indissolubilmente a un volto, a un evento preciso e dà il ritmo ai ricordi; soprattutto quella musica partorita da una scintilla d’amore, capace di provocare altre scintille nel cuore e nella mente di chi ascolta.
column12: Prendi la parola!

RadioViGiova è un’occasione di incontro e di ascolto: lungo le molteplici strade del progetto RadioViGiova, si incontrano giovani in ricerca, da chi compone lo staff a chi ci ascolta in FM o in internet, agli ospiti in studio: ognuno si porta dentro la propria esperienza, ognuno condivide con gioia i passi del proprio cammino; è un intrecciarsi di percorsi con un centro di gravità permanente in comune: quella dimensione spirituale che ognuno chiama con nomi diversi, quella voce interiore che per alcuni lo scontro con le scelte quotidiane, per altri ancora una linea sottile difficile da seguire…

L’ascolto e il rispetto della ricchezza dentro ogni diversità vogliono essere gli ingredienti speciali della ricetta RadioViGiova; così di puntata in puntata si è realizzata una rete fitta e splendida di mille colori, che unisce moltissimi giovani: lungo questi intrecci corrono idee, pensieri, sentimenti, speranze, progetti, in un generarsi esponenziale per contagio…

Linguaggio comune è la musica, scelta, amata, ballata; quella che ti accompagna come un tarlo nella mente lungo la giornata; quella che si unisce indissolubilmente a un volto, a un evento preciso e dà il ritmo ai ricordi; soprattutto quella musica partorita da una scintilla d’amore, capace di provocare altre scintille nel cuore e nella mente di chi ascolta.

column11:
Neljä miestä kokoontuvat puisen pöydän ympärille, juovat viskiä ja pohtivat todellisuuden ja elämän ihmeellistä monimuotoisuutta. He nostavat maljoja, kertovat tarinoita, jakavat ideoita ja nauravat. Radio Wyrd on podcast, joka syntyy näistä hetkistä pöydän ympärillä. 

Podcastin aiheet ovat rajattomat ja vaihtelevat kepeän hauskoista hartaan vakaviin. Käsiteltävänä saattaa olla yhtälailla erilaiset kulttuurin muodot kuin ajankohtaiset ilmiöt, niin muinaiset sivilisaatiot kuin tulevaisuuden visiotkin.

Pöydän äärelle kutsutaan ajoittain erinäisiä vieraita jakamaan heidän omia näkemyksiään. Radio Wyrd on kuin nykypäivän versio antiikin areenoista, jossa tarinat ja ideat kohtaavat vuoropuheluna- vuoropuheluna, joka perustuu toveruuteen ja hengenheimolaisuuteen, prometeaaniseen tiedonjanoon, sekä kuvia kumartelemattomaan huumoriin.

column11: Radio2 Supermax, il grande live show di Radio 2 è arrivato al suo quarto anno. La festa mattutina capitanata da Max Giusti questanno vede una novità importante, una nuova conduttrice che risponde al nome di Laura Barriales. Il pubblico potrà apprezzare in pieno la simpatia della famosa showgirl spagnola che per la prima volta si cimenta con il mezzo radiofonico, abituata comè agli schermi televisivi. Ce nè per tutti: lattualità raccontata da SuperMax passa per personaggi ormai diventati classici, dal parrucchiere Icaro a Pedro Almodovar, dallo sgangherato playboy Mariuccio a Terence Hill, leroe, cui si continuano ad affiancare nuove voci.

We are just a couple of relatively normal guys, with normal families, jobs, lives, etc.. With one exception, our love for amateur radio!
Our goal with the RadioActive Ham Podcast is to change the public perception of radio operators from the odd to the norm.
No more weird looks when talking on the radio, no more family or friends asking about your "CB" etc...
We hope to do this PLUS inform, educate and entertain.
Enjoy

column11:
Marie Curie, born in Warsaw in 1867, was a Polish-French physicist and chemist famous for her work on radioactivity. She was a pioneer in the field of radioactivity and the first person honored with two Nobel Prizes - in physics (1903) and chemistry (1911). The risks of working with strongly radioactive materials were not known at that time, and she eventually died in 1934 from an illness likely caused by radiation poisoning.

Radioactive Substances is the thesis of Marie Curie, presented to the Faculté de Sciences de Paris in 1903, and subsequently published in "Chemical News" vol 88, 1903. Marie Curie gives a detailed description of her research on radioactive substances carried out at the Sorbonne. She details how she obtained the two new elements radium and polonium from pitchblende, explains her numerous experiments and presents measurements of all kinds. (Summary by Availle)

column11: Dalle mostre agli spettacoli, dai musei al cinema, dai racconti d’autore alle tradizioni enogastronomiche: la cultura dell’Emilia-Romagna raccontata in 7 rubriche che traducono in parole e musica le città d’arte, i prodotti tipici, i musei, la tradizione e l’innovazione culinaria, i teatri storici, le rassegne e i festival, la letteratura.
column12: I sapori, i pensieri, i colori e le ragioni di un territorio che unisce ogni giorno, sotto le stesso cielo, l’antico e il moderno.

column11: L’economia, i protagonisti, gli interventi della Regione Emilia-Romagna per le imprese in Italia e all'estero attraverso la Consulta per l'emigrazione.  E’ la voce degli esperti ad approfondire i principali fatti e a raccontare le politiche regionali nella rubrica “Economia & Società”. Le associazioni di emiliano-romagnoli nel mondo sono il serbatoio da cui provengono le storie che vi raccontiamo, in cui l’emigrazione si intreccia con il ricordo, la nostalgia, lo spirito di eccellenza, la ricerca di un altrove.
column12: L’economia, i protagonisti, gli interventi della Regione Emilia-Romagna per le imprese e il turismo.

column11: Le cento associazioni di emiliano-romagnoli nel mondo sono il serbatoio da cui provengono le storie che vi raccontiamo, in cui l’emigrazione si intreccia con il ricordo, la nostalgia, lo spirito di eccellenza, la ricerca di un altrove.
column12: Storie in cui l’emigrazione si intreccia con il ricordo, la nostalgia, lo spirito di eccellenza, la ricerca di un altrove.

column11: Informazioni sui principali eventi in corso in Emilia-Romagna.
column12: Informazioni sui principali eventi in corso in Emilia-Romagna.

column11: Tre le rubriche dedicate ai giovani esordienti: Scelto per voi, Magazzini Free Music, Mei Web Radio. Una Hit parade italiana a cura di Radio Bruno. I luoghi, le storie e gli eventi culturali del territorio trovano nel Paesaggio dell’anima il loro racconto in musica. E poi gli eventi live: brani tratti da concerti e spettacoli realizzati nei teatri e nelle rassegne dell’Emilia-Romagna.
column12: Nuovi talenti, patrimonio tradizionale, ricerca contemporanea: la nota dominante di RadioEmiliaRomagna è la musica, in tutti i suoi generi.

column11: Un doppio appuntamento sull’attività della Regione, le news dell’Istituto per i Beni Culturali, gli eventi e l’attualità di interesse emiliano-romagnolo, le previsioni del tempo a cura dell’Agenzia regionale per la prevenzione e l’ambiente.
column12: Le notizie più importanti dalla Regione Emilia-Romagna in 6 sezioni: dagli eventi all’attualità, dalle attività culturali al meteo

column11: Il Paesaggio dell’Anima è un viaggio in regione attraverso la musica. I paesaggi culturali, storici, artistici si incrociano con i paesaggi fisici, la pianura, il mare, gli Appennini, costruendo un mosaico di emozioni, spunti, divagazioni in cui collocare le musiche prodotte in regione da artisti emiliano-romagnoli. Ma non solo: musiche di tutto il mondo e di tutti i generi intervengono a dilatare il microcosmo Emilia-Romagna in un macrocosmo in cui ognuno può specchiarsi.
column12: Il Paesaggio dell’Anima è un viaggio in regione attraverso la musica.

column11: La storia come la cronaca, l’attualità come le nebbie del passato, ci restituiscono le imprese, le opere, i sogni, le sconfitte, le realizzazioni di emiliano-romagnoli dalla biografia che vale la pena ricordare o indagare.
column12: Le imprese, le opere, i sogni, le sconfitte, le realizzazioni di emiliano-romagnoli.

column11: L’emozione della parola scritta ascoltata per radio. Autori noti e meno noti, famosissimi o esordienti, nati nella nostra regione o adottati da essa, oppure capaci di raccontarla anche venendo da fuori: parole, versi, che fanno pensare o sognare. La rubrica è anche uno strumento utile per chi all’estero desideri imparare l’italiano.
column12: L’emozione della parola scritta di autori nati o adottati dalla Regione Emilia-Romagna ascoltata per radio.

Radiolab is a show about curiosity. Where sound illuminates ideas, and  the boundaries blur between science, philosophy, and human experience.
Radiolab is heard around the country on more than 450 NPR member stations. Check your local station for airtimes.
Embed the Radiolab widget on your blog or website.

Radiolab is supported, in part, by the National Science Foundation and the Alfred P. Sloan Foundation, enhancing public understanding of science and technology in the modern world. More information about Sloan at www.sloan.org.
All press inquiries may be directed to Jennifer Houlihan Roussel at (646) 829-4497.
column12: On Radiolab, science meets culture and information sounds like music. Each episode of Radiolab® is an investigation -- a patchwork of people, sounds, stories and experiences centered around One Big Idea. Hosted by Jad Abumrad and Robert Krulwich, Radiolab

Les Radiolivres sont des nouvelles écrites sur commande pour deBuren par des auteurs néerlandais et flamands et lues en public. Ce sont des textes inédits écrits spécialement pour être écoutés et qui ne seront pas publiés sur papier. Les nouvelles sont lues en public par leurs auteurs à une seule et unique occasion. Les Radiolivres sont ensuite diffusés par radio et via Internet, où ils peuvent gratuitement être écoutés ou enregistrés.

Kontakt os på einfach@braingaingroup.com

column11: Få professionel hjælp til at leve dit liv på Radio24syv. Hverdagsaftener, mellem kl. 22 og 23, sidder et håndplukket udvalg af rådgivere klar til at hjælpe danskerne med vejledning indenfor emner som sex og samliv, jura, psykologi og spiritualitet. Så hvis du har krise i parforholdet, er kommet i klemme i systemet eller døjer med stress kan Radiorådet hjælpe dig.

column11:
Radiorepubliken är världens nyaste och fräschaste land som styrs genom demokratisk despotism. Har du också tröttnat på byråkrat-Sverige? Det enda som krävs för att du ska få medborgarskap är att du lyssnar på oss!

Vi gör klassiskt syrlig satir, blandat med absurdism.
Du hör ditt nya land förkunna sina ord på 
ONSDAGAR 16.00 i  Radio AF 99,1 - www.radioaf.se - 

Regeringen består av: Niklas Linderoth, Erik Adell och Jakob Green Werkmäster.

column11: Радио шоу "Night Flight" - музыкальная программа на FM радиостанции "Серебряный дождь". Ведущий программы - Sasha Skyward. Длительность радио-шоу 1 час. Первая часть эфира - это разнообразные миксы в стиле Trance. Вторая часть эфира - гостевые миксы от разносторонних диджеев и музыкантов, а также общение по ходу программы. В эфир выходит каждый 2-ой и 4-ый четверг месяца в 22:00 на частоте 100.2 МГц.

column11: Radiostar: Improv is a weekly, completely improvised theatrical radio show. New stories every week, spawned directly from the minds of some of San Francisco's sharpest improvisers.

In "The Studio Interviews", Diana Brown (assisted by the Radiostar ensemble) interview San Francisco Bay Area theatre artists. Playwrights, Directors, Performers of all stripes are interviewed on current projects, process, trends, and philosophy.

En plein échec professionnel et sentimental, Ben, qui se rêvait comique à New York, est de retour à Paris. Il rencontre Alex, présentateur-vedette du Breakfast-club, le Morning star de la radio. Avec Cyril, un quadra mal assumé, et Arnold, le leader charismatique de la bande, ils font la pluie et le beau temps sur Blast FM. Très vite Ben est engagé : il écrira pour eux. Alors qu’il a à peine rejoint l’équipe, un raz-de-marée frappe de plein fouet la station : l’audience du Breakfast est en chute libre. C’est en bus qu’ils sillonneront les routes de France pour rencontrer et reconquérir leur public. Pour ces Parisiens arrogants, de ce road trip radiophonique naîtra un véritable parcours initiatique qui bousculera leurs certitudes.
column12: RADIOSTARS

column11: Savnssending Jólakalendarasøgan hjá Barnaútvarpinum 2011, eitur - Rændu Gimsteinarnir. Tvíburðarnir Ida og Hjalti búgva í einum vanligum húsi onkrastaðni í Føroyum. Pápin er sjómaður. Tað fyrsta, vit hoyra um tey bæði, er, at Hjalti ikki hevur tað so lætt í skúlanum, tí dreingirnir arga hann. Ida roynir at hjálpa honum, men tað vil Hjalti ikki. Ida greiðir mammu síni frá støðuni, og mamman sigur uggandi, at tað fer at verða betri. Um náttina kemur ein løgin vera inn í kamarið hjá Idu og Hjalta. Veran er bangin, og biður tey hjálpa sær. Tey skilja onki, og verða síðani tikin úr kamarinum, og førd í annan heim. Søgan er ævintýrakend. Børnini eru útvald at fara í aðra verð, at bjarga rændu gimsteinunum. Tað er ikki so lætt, tí har eru nógvar forðingar og nógvir vandar. Har eru óndar djóraverur, men eisini vinarligar og hjálpsamar djóraverur. Vónandi sigrar tað góða innan jólaaftan, og børnini megna at bjarga rændu gimsteinunum, til tess at koma heimaftur at halda jól hjá mammu og pápa. Tá ið søgan er ævintýrakend, so kunnu øll børn og øll vaksin lurta. Vit hoyra eina spennandi søgu, sum onkuntíð er óhugnalig, men dirvi og megin hjá børnunum sigrar allatíðina, og Ida og Hjalti eru hetjur. Ein maður sigur einum smádrongi frá spennandi søgu. Drongurin er forvitin, og fær meira og meira at vita, sum dagarnir í desembur mánaða ganga. Søgan verður borðreidd við nógvum ljóði, tónleiki og sangi, sum hóskar til innihaldið. Jólakalendarasøgan "Rændu Gimsteinarnir" eru at hoyra mánadag, týsdag, hósdag og fríggjadag klokkan 7:15 og eftir tíðindini á kvøldi klokkan 18:20. Tað eru Katrin Nolsøe og Kári Sólstein, sum skrivaðu søguna í 2004. Finnur Hansen var tøkningur. Hann gjørdi ljóðmyndina, og legði eisini tónleikin til rættis. Kári Jacobsen gjørdi tíggju sangir til leikin - orð og løg
column12: Savnssending Jólakalendarasøgan hjá Barnaútvarpinum 2011, eitur - Rændu Gimsteinarnir. Tvíburðarnir Ida og Hjalti búgva í einum vanligum húsi onkrastaðni í Føroyum. Vit hoyra eina spennandi søgu, sum onkuntíð er óhugnalig, men dirvi og megin hjá børnunum sigrar allatíðina, og Ida og Hjalti eru hetjur. Ein maður sigur einum smádrongi frá spennandi søgu. Drongurin er forvitin, og fær meira og meira at vita, sum dagarnir í desembur mánaða ganga. Søgan verður borðreidd við nógvum ljóði, tónleiki og sangi, sum hóskar til innihaldið. Jólakalendarasøgan "Rændu Gimsteinarnir" eru at hoyra mánadag, týsdag, hósdag og fríggjadag klokkan 7:15 og eftir tíðindini á kvøldi klokkan 18:20. Tað eru Katrin Nolsøe og Kári Sólstein, sum skrivaðu søguna í 2004. Finnur Hansen var tøkningur. Hann gjørdi ljóðmyndina, og legði eisini tónleikin til rættis. Kári Jacobsen gjørdi tíggju sangir til leikin - orð og løg

column2: Ragged Trousered Philanthropists, The by TRESSELL, Robert
column11:
Clearly frustrated at the refusal of his contemporaries to recognise the iniquity of society, Tressell's cast of hypocritical Christians, exploitative capitalists and corrupt councillors provide a backdrop for his main target — the workers who think that a better life is "not for the likes of them". Hence the title of the book; Tressell paints the workers as "philanthropists" who throw themselves into back-breaking work for poverty wages in order to generate profit for their masters.

The hero of the book, Frank Owen, is a socialist who believes that the capitalist system is the real source of the poverty he sees all around him. In vain he tries to convince his fellow workers of his world view, but finds that their education has trained them to distrust their own thoughts and to rely on those of their "betters". Much of the book consists of conversations between Owen and the others, or more often of lectures by Owen in the face of their jeering; this was presumably based on Tressell's own experiences.(Summary by Tadhg)

column2: Raggedy Ann Stories by GRUELLE, Johnny
column11:
To the millions of children and grown-ups who have loved a Rag Doll, the author dedicated these stories. Now listen as eight voices read to you Raggedy Ann's exciting adventures, as gentle and charming today, as they were when first published in 1918.

Find out what is written on her candy heart, what was the gift the fairies brought, and all about Raggedy Ann's new sisters. (summary by Cori)

column2: Raggedy Ann Stories (version 2) by GRUELLE, Johnny
column11: This is the book that started it all. Johnny Gruelle gave his daughter Marcella a rag doll, on which he had drawn an eternally smiling face. Marcella and Raggedy Ann became inseparable, and inspired Gruelle to write Raggedy Ann Stories, which was sold with its very own Raggedy Ann doll. Sadly, Marcella died at age 13 after complications from a smallpox vaccine, but Gruelle continued writing about Raggedy Ann. (description by Zachary Brewster-Geisz)

column11:
Rahaan has been dropping disco and funky house beats to retro music heads since the 80’s when he and his friends use to dance at the best house parties in Chicago – Rahaan’s home state and most importantly, the place which gave birth to House music.

Playing at house parties in Chicago obviously done Rahaan some good, as he is now a successful DJ and music producer in his own right. He recently released Rahaan Edits Vol. 1 and 2 in 2008/9 on Stillove4music record label as well as putting out some remixes on the KAT record label.

The thing about Rahaan is that he defiantly knows his art, and it is his outstanding skill behind the decks that has brought him from the Chicago underground circuit out onto the international playing field of Japan, Australia, Amsterdam, Spain, Ireland, Scotland, England, throughout America.

But before Rahaan made his presence on the global dance floor, Rahaan was playing his music from his cassette tapes with his dance crew called the Chuck Brothers. He then moved to the state of Wisconsin whereby he started to grow a serious collection of disco and house records. In 1996 Rahaan moved back to Chicago started hanging out with his old friends, forming the reunion of the Chuck Brothers once again.

During the 90’s Rahaan was building up his reputation as one of Chicago’s finest Disco/House DJ, playing at a hot club called “The Spot” and the infamous loft parties with Mr.Bill, Pee Wee and friends. This opened the door for Rahaan to perform on guest spots for Sisterz of Vision and Soul In The Hole club nights, followed by a residency “Budda Lounge” – one of Chicago’s best nightclubs.

In the year 2000 Rahaan started producing tracks for his own personal collection but this soon gained him the attention of Fourplay records who signed him up straight away. His first major track releases on this label were ‘Coming Hard’ and “No Time for Love.”

Since then, Rahaan has released numerous mixes on various websites such as Deep House and Bring The Heat, which gained him attention from other record labels and music lovers across the world. His performances have included the Southport Weekender, Northern Soul and Bring The Heat parties, which you can view on the website.

In between touring Rahaan is busy producing soulful disco and house music for Australian singer Christine Eva and Atlanta based singer/songwriter Ozara Ode’. It is fair to say that Rahaan is well and truly on his way to accomplishing bigger and better things for the year ahead.

column11:
Rahiem, aka “Ra” was born and raised in the Bronx, New York. He has been a prominent force in the Hip-Hop industry since its inception. Ra started as a member of the pioneering Hip-Hop group Grandmaster Flash and the Furious Five; one of VH1’s 2005 Hip Hop Honorees. In 2007 these legendary lyricists became the first Hip-Hop performers to be inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame.
Rahiem has collaborated with such artistic talents as: Nas, Teddy Riley, Angela Winbush and award-winning producer Dr. Dre.
In 1992 he demonstrated to the world his musical strengths by transitioning from great MC into professional vocalist, for the R&B soundtrack single “Does Your Man Know about Me” from the feature film Juice. He received a Gold record for writing and producing the song.
In the fall of 2009 Ra debuted his first radio single entitled “Gettin Money,” from his upcoming solo album due for release summer of 2010.
Ra has made many public appearances including a memorable performance on the David Letterman Show. He has a passion for acting and has worked as an extra in a range of films. His charming personality and charismatic smile is why the public continues to love and respect him. His notoriety can best be revealed through those famous lyrics “Rahiem in the ladies’ dream.”
An educator of Hip-Hop Culture, Ra continues to be a trailblazer in the entertainment industry. Whether hosting an event/show, making appearances or through film and television; he will enlighten, encourage and influence his audiences in a myriad of ways. Ra is ready for what’s to come!

column11: Every other week you will be treated to a new, free RailsCasts episode featuring tips and tricks with Ruby on Rails, the popular web development framework. These screencasts are short and focus on one technique so you can quickly move on to applying it to your own project. The topics are geared toward the intermediate Rails developer, but beginners and experts will get something out of it as well. A Pro option is also available containing more screencasts each week. This is the full resolution version, a lower reoslution for mobile devices is also available.

column11: RailsCasts China由太檑(Terry Tai)制作。 此网站的目的是帮助中国Rails/Ruby社区中的程序员更快更方便的掌握Rails/Ruby开发技巧。这些Screencasts主要针对入门和中级用户。当然如果高级用户也能从中发现一些值得借鉴或者批评的地方，我更是倍感荣幸。我将尽量遵循由浅入深，循序渐进的原则来制作视频。但总体来讲所有视频是互相独立的，所以并不是一个体系完整的教程。因此并不适合作为唯一学习手段，而是更适合作为一种辅助。最后，希望对你有所帮助。

column2: Railway Bridge of the Silvery Tay, The by MCGONAGALL, William Topaz
column11:
LibriVox volunteers bring you nine different readings of The Railway Bridge of the Silvery Tay, by William McGonagall, to celebrate April Fool's Day. Scottish poet William McGonagall is widely considered to be one of the worst poets of the English language. He wrote this poem in honor of The Tay Rail Bridge which was opened in 1878 and which subsequently collapsed a year later, causing the death of 75 train passengers, and inspiring McGonagall to write yet famously bad poem entitled The Tay Bridge Disaster. This was the weekly poetry project for the week of March 26, 2006.
(Summary by Annie Coleman)

LibriVox volunteers bring you 16 recordings of The Railway Train by Emily Dickinson. This was the Weekly Poetry project for May 28, 2011.

Although Dickinson was a prolific private poet, fewer than a dozen of her nearly eighteen hundred poems were published during her lifetime. The work that was published during her lifetime was usually altered significantly by the publishers to fit the conventional poetic rules of the time. Dickinson's poems are unique for the era in which she wrote; they contain short lines, typically lack titles, and often use slant rhyme as well as unconventional capitalization and punctuation.[3] Many of her poems deal with themes of death and immortality, two recurring topics in letters to her friends. (summary from Wikipedia)

column2: Rainbow Trail, The by GREY, Zane
column11: The Rainbow Trail is a sequel to The Riders of the Purple Sage. Both novels are notable for their protagonists' mild opposition to Mormon polygamy, but in The Rainbow Trail this theme is treated more explicitly. The plots of both books revolve around the victimization of women in the Mormon culture: events in Riders of the Purple Sage are centered on the struggle of a Mormon woman who sacrifices her wealth and social status to avoid becoming a junior wife of the head of a local church, while The Rainbow Trail contrasts the older Mormons with the rising generation of Mormon women who will not tolerate polygamy and Mormon men who do not seek it. (Summary Wikipedia)

column2: Rainbow Valley by Lucy Maud Montgomery
column11: Rainbow Valley, the seventh book in the Anne of Green Gables series explores the world of Anne & Gilbert’s six children along with the exploits of the Merediths, the children of the town’s new minister. With no mother and an absent-minded father, the Meredith children are not being properly brought up. This leads to their many adventures causing the ladies of the town to gossip, risking their father’s job. These kind-hearted, but misguided children fumble their way through bringing themselves up, and learn about life and love along the way. All books in this series:1 Anne of Green Gables2 Anne of Avonlea3 Anne of the Island5 Anne’s House of Dreams7 Rainbow Valley8 Rilla of Ingleside

Exklusive Produkte von Ralph Reichts unter http://www.disneystore.de/
Ab 6. Dezember 2012 im Kino in 3D!


Der neueste Disney Animationsfilm für die ganze Familie von den Machern von „Simpsons". 

Tagein, tagaus muss Ralph den Bösewicht mimen und in dem 8-Bit-Videospiel „Fix-it Felix Jr." die Rolle des Zerstörers spielen. Und natürlich haben ihm die Programmierer einen Kontrahenten zurechtgepixelt, der alles besser kann, schneller ist und immer die Lorbeeren erntet: Felix Jr., der freundliche Handwerker, der alles im Nu repariert und mit Medaillen behängt wird, die Ralph so gerne hätte. 

So bleibt Ralph nichts anderes übrig als nachts, wenn die Lichter in der Spielhalle ausgehen, sein Glück in einem anderen Arcadespiel zu suchen, um endlich auch einmal eine der begehrten Medaillen in den Händen zu halten.

Begleitet Ralph auf seiner Reise nach Anerkennung durch die rasante, aufregende Welt der Videospiele und trefft auf alte Bekannte aus legendären Computerspiel-Klassikern. 

Regisseur Rich Moore, hierzulande bekannt geworden als einer der Regisseure der Kultserien „Die Simpsons" und „Futurama" beweist auch mit RALPH REICHTS sein Gespür für originelles, slapstickgeladenes Entertainment. RALPH REICHTS ist ein visuell aufregendes und vor allem witziges Animationsabenteuer für die ganze Familie, das die Welt der Arcadespiele zeigt, wie man sie noch nie zuvor gesehen hat. Der Kinospaß entführt seine Zuschauer in einen poppig-bunten Kosmos voller schräger Charaktere mit Marotten, Spleens, Leidenschaften und Herz und gibt zugleich einen bisweilen nostalgischen, vor allem aber einzigartigen Blick hinter die Kulissen der Automatenspiele, der vor allem Kinofans begeistern wird, die nicht unbedingt Gamer sind. Das ist Kinounterhaltung auf einem ganz neuen Level -- in vielen Kinos auch in Disney Digital 3D®!


Ein Film voller Witz, Leidenschaft und Herz in Disney Digital 3D -- Vorhang auf!
Ab 6. Dezember 2012 im Kino!

Viel Spaß!

column11: The Ramayan(a) is an ancient Sanskrit epic. It is attributed to the Hindu sage Valmiki and forms an important part of the Hindu canon (smṛti). The Ramayana is one of the two great epics of India, the other being Mahabharata. It depicts the duties of relationships, portraying ideal characters like the ideal servant, the ideal brother, the ideal wife and the ideal king. (Summary from Wikipedia)

column11: The Ramayan(a) is an ancient Sanskrit epic. It is attributed to the Hindu sage Valmiki and forms an important part of the Hindu canon (smṛti). The Ramayana is one of the two great epics of India, the other being Mahabharata. It is the story of Rama, who emabrks on an epic journey followed by the fight with Ravana, the demon king who abducted Rama's wife, Sita. The epic depicts the duties of relationships, portraying ideal characters like the ideal servant, the ideal brother, the ideal wife and the ideal king. (Introduction by Om123)

The Ramayana is one of the two great epics of India, the other being Mahabharata. It is the story of Rama, who embarks on an epic journey followed by the fight with Ravana, the demon king who abducted Rama's wife, Sita. The epic depicts the duties of relationships, portraying ideal characters like the ideal servant, the ideal brother, the ideal wife and the ideal king. (Summary by om123)

column11: Rameau's Nephew, or the Second Satire (French: Le Neveu de Rameau ou La Satire seconde) is an imaginary philosophical conversation written by Denis Diderot, probably between 1761 and 1772. It was first published in 1805 in German translation by Goethe, but the French manuscript used has subsequently disappeared. The German version was translated back into French by de Saur and Saint-Geniès and published in 1821. The first published version based on French manuscript appeared in 1823 in the Brière edition of Diderot's works. Modern editions are based on the complete manuscript in Diderot’s own hand found by Georges Monval, the librarian at the Comédie-Française, in 1890 while buying music scores from a second-hand bookshop in Paris.[1] Monval published his edition of the manuscript in 1891. Subsequently, the manuscript was bought by the Pierpont Morgan Library in New York. It is unclear why Diderot never had it published in his time. Given the satirical tone of the work, it has been suggested that the author prudently refrained from giving offence. (Summary by wikipedia)

column11: Ramona, a novel written by Helen Hunt Jackson (1884), is the story of a part-Scottish and part-Native American orphan girl growing up and getting married in Southern California, suffering racial discrimination and hardship. Originally serialized in the Christian Union on a weekly basis, the novel became immensely popular. Overall, it has had more than 300 printings, been made into four film versions, and has been performed as an outdoor play annually since 1923. The impact the novel had on the culture and image of Southern California was enormous. Its romanticization of Mexican colonial life gave the region a unique cultural identity and its publication coincided with the arrival of railroad lines to the region, bringing in countless tourists who wanted to see the locations in the novel. (Summary from Wikipedia)

column11:
Set in Old California in the wake of the Mexican-American War, Ramona is two stories at once. It is the story of the love between a part-Native American orphan girl, Ramona, and Alessandro, a young Indian sheepherder. It is also the story of racial prejudice and the clash between cultures as California changes from a Spanish colony to an American territory. Ramona is the ward of Señora Gonzaga Moreno, who despises the girl for her race but honors the dying wish of the Señora's sister, Ramona's foster-mother, to raise her as her own. Señora Moreno embodies the aloof arrogance of Spanish nobility, hating both the Americans who dispute her claim to her vast rancho, and the Indians, whom she places in the same social class with slaves. Her only semblance of love is reserved for her son Felipe.

Despite the Señora's machinations, Ramona and Alessandro fall in love, and eventually elope. But their life together is not an easy one, as they roam the Southern California searching for a home. Their many hardships cannot dull their love for one another, but they soon take a toll that changes their lives forever. (Introduction by Christine Dufour)

column11:
In Theaters February 10th.

Los Angeles, 1999.  Officer Dave Brown (two-time Academy Award(R) nominee Woody Harrelson) is a Vietnam vet and a Rampart Precinct cop, dedicated to doing "the people's dirty work" and asserting his own code of justice, often blurring the lines between right and wrong to maintain his action-hero state of mind. When he gets caught on tape beating a suspect, he finds himself in a personal and emotional downward spiral as the consequences of his past sins and his refusal to change his ways in light of a department-wide corruption scandal seal his fate. Brown internalizes his fear, anguish and paranoia as his world, complete with two ex-wives who are sisters, two daughters, an aging mentor dispensing bad advice, investigators galore, and a series of seemingly random women, starts making less and less sense. In the end, what is left is a human being stripped of all his pretense, machismo, chauvinism, arrogance, sexism, homophobia, racism, aggression, misanthropy; but is it enough to redeem him as a man?

Features:
Woody Harrelson, Ned Beatty, Ben Foster, Anne Heche, Ice Cube, Cynthia Nixon, Sigourney Weaver, Robin Wright, Steve Buscemi
column12: In Theaters February 10th.

column2: Ranald Bannerman’s Boyhood by George MacDonald
column11: George MacDonald is mainly known for his fantasy works and fairy tales such as At the Back of the North Wind and The Princess and the Goblin. However, during his life he was more famous for many more realistic novels. . . among them the somewhat autobiographical Ranald Bannerman’s Boyhood. This story of a young motherless boy growing up with his brothers in a Scottish manse is full of delightful characters. There is Kirsty, an enchanting Highland storyteller, Turkey, the intrepid cowherd, the evil Kelpie, and the lovely Elsie Duff. Throughout the twists and turns of his escapades and adventures Ranald learns from his father the important lessons of courage and integrity. When Ranald Bannerman’s Boyhood came out in 1871 the New York Independent praised it as “full of sweetness, full of boy-life and true goodness”. Perhaps, but it is also a good story, from the master of storytellers.

column11: Random Logic alias Gregor Zemljic & Miha Klemencic are the longest established artists of the Slovene electronic music scene. They have also written music for major and alternative theatre, ballet and experimental art performances (they are collaborating extensively with the artist Marko Peljhan on his multimedia projects) and also for films. In the year 2000 they were awarded the Studio City Boomerang Award (alternative Slovenian music awards) for the best live techno act in Slovenia and recently they won 1st prize at The 2002 RFI (Radio France International) Musiques Electroniques Award for the best electronic project in Central and Eastern Europe.

column11:
A good book by the oil revolutionist of the 20th century. As they say "Men should listen to experience" and this book is all about the experience of the second highest taxpayer of the US during the 20's. Though it is not in the book, this is a small poem he wrote:

I was early taught to work as well as play,
My life has been one long, happy holiday;
Full of work and full of play-
I dropped the worry on the way-
And God was good to me everyday.

(Summary by sidhu177)

column6: National Parks of New York Harbor Conservancy
column11: Seventeen species of hawks, sandy beaches, a network of military forts and the site of George Washington's first inauguration -- all can be found among the National Parks of New York Harbor.  No one knows these special places better than the naturalists, scientists and historians who work at them as National Park Service Rangers.  In this new podcast series, park rangers share their insider stories about the wonders to be seen at these national treasures. Produced by the National Parks of New York Harbor Conservancy, located on the web at: nyharborparks.org.
column12: An insider's look at America's national parks that ring New York Harbor

column11: RangiRangi Weekly

Canadian novelist Guy Morton's Rangy Pete is one of a trio of westerns he wrote in the 1920s (the other two being Black Gold and Wards of the Azure Hills). In this one, the Gary Cooper-esque title character, Rangy Pete, goes up against the Dervishers, and outlaw clan that's been stirring up trouble for the peaceable folks of Triple Butte. In so doing, he encounters a beautiful blue-eyed girl-bandit who promptly throws a lasso around his heart. As the action heats up, the grandeur of magnificent western landscape does battle with the picturesqueness of Rangy's colorful cowboy argot, and the reader comes out the winner.

Guy Morton wrote a score of novels in the 1920s and 1930s that found popularity especially in Britain and Australia. Besides westerns, he wrote spy-thrillers, such as The Black Robe (filmed in Canada as Secrets of Chinatown in 1935), featuring secret agent Donegal Dawn, as well as a dozen or so murder mysteries, often told with a comic touch. He was a Toronto-based journalist and worked as an editor of The Globe and Mail. (Summary by Grant Hurlock)
